title: Ice Magic
data:
***Version [0.32](/0.32 "0.32")**: This article is up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of *Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup*.*

**Ice Magic** skill determines how easily you can cast spells that employ ice, cold, and frost.

Ice Magic provides many "subtle" spells: most Ice spells cause passive effects, affect a large area, or both. Many of them are [quiet](/Noise "Noise"). In this way, the school strikes a good balance between offense and defense. Ice-based spells are generally resistible with [cold resistance](/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").

- [0.27](/0.27 "0.27") redesigned [Absolute Zero](/Absolute_Zero "Absolute Zero") into [Maxwell's Capacitive Coupling](/Maxwell%27s_Capacitive_Coupling "Maxwell's Capacitive Coupling"), an [Air](/Air "Air") spell. - [0.25](/0.25 "0.25") removed [Throw Frost](/Throw_Frost "Throw Frost"), [Throw Icicle](/Throw_Icicle "Throw Icicle"), [Bolt of Cold](/Bolt_of_Cold "Bolt of Cold"), and [Glaciate](/Glaciate "Glaciate") as part of the spell rework, adding [Frozen Ramparts](/Frozen_Ramparts "Frozen Ramparts"), [Hailstorm](/Hailstorm "Hailstorm"), and [Absolute Zero](/Absolute_Zero "Absolute Zero").

Ice Magic skill determines how easily you can cast spells that employ ice, cold, and frost.

Ice Magic provides many "subtle" spells: most Ice spells cause passive effects, affect a large area, or both. Many of them are quiet. In this way, the school strikes a good balance between offense and defense. Ice-based spells are generally resistible with cold resistance.
